entry.title: Prime numbers of a kind x^2+1
entry.summary: The number of primes of a kind x^2+1 is infinite.

entry.title: On the set of natural numbers
entry.summary: This paper was withdrawn by the authors.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn. See math.GM/0202132

entry.title: Simple proofing of Jordan's theorem
entry.summary: Here is present short proofing of Jordan's theorem about dividing of flat on two disjoint subsets by one closed curve.

entry.title: Riemann Hypothesis
entry.summary: Through an equivalent condition on the Farey series set forth by Franel and Landau, we prove Riemann Hypothesis for the Riemann zeta-function and the Dirichlet L-function.

entry.title: Sieve Method and Landau Problem
entry.summary: We solve Landau's four unattackable problems, including Goldbach Conjecture and Twin Prime Conjecture through sieve method.

entry.title: Simple Divisibility Rules for the 1st 1000 Prime Numbers
entry.summary: Simple divisibility rules are given for the 1st 1000 prime numbers.

entry.title: Random triangle problem: geometrical approach
entry.summary: Classical problem of random triangle in square is solved by simple and transparent geometrical method.

entry.title: Experimental detection of interactive phenomena and their analysis
entry.summary: The article is devoted to mathematical methods of experimental detection of interactive phenomena in complex systems and their analysis.

entry.title: Matrix exponentials
entry.summary: We give a formula for matrix exponentials and partial fraction decompositions.

entry.title: New mathematical methods for psychophysical filtering of experimental data and their processing
entry.summary: The article is devoted to new mathematical methods for psychophysical filtering of experimental data and their processing.

entry.title: Le cryptosysteme non-commutatif
entry.summary: It is showed a new cryptosystem based on non-commutativ calculations of matrices, more specially nilpotent matrices. The cryptosystem seems powerful to restsist against usual attacks.

entry.title: Testing the Existence of a Supporting Plane
entry.summary: We present an algorithm testing wheather, for given four vectors in R^3, there is a plane through the origin such that all four vectors fall into the same open halfspace.

entry.title: The Mathematical Universe in a Nutshell
entry.summary: The mathematical universe discussed here gives models of possible structures our physical universe can have.

entry.title: Automorphisms of the category of free Lie algebras
entry.summary: We prove that every automorphism of the category of free Lie algebras is a semi-inner automorphism.

entry.title: Geometrical Equivalents of Goldbach Conjecture and Fermat Like Theorem
entry.summary: Five geometrical eqivalents of Goldbach conjecture are given, calling one of them Fermat Like Theorem.

entry.title: A Theorem on Prime Numbers
entry.summary: The theorem presented in this paper allows the creation of large prime numbers (of order up to o(n^2)) given a table of all primes up to n.

entry.title: On Reidys and Stadler's metrics for RNA secondary structures
entry.summary: We compute explicitly several abstract metrics for RNA secondary structures defined by Reidys and Stadler.

entry.title: Is mathematics consistent?
entry.summary: A question is proposed whether or not set theory is consistent.

entry.title: Does Church-Kleene ordinal $ω_1^{CK}$ exist?
entry.summary: A question is proposed if a nonrecursive ordinal, the so-called Church-Kleene ordinal $\omega_1^{CK}$ really exists.

entry.title: The Proof of Goldbach Conjecture, Twin Primes Conjecture and Other Two Propositions
entry.summary: By creating a new method, the author proved the well-known world's baffling problems Goldbach conjecture, twin primes conjecture, the Proposition (C) and the Proposition $n^2+1$.

entry.title: Claims On Primorial Primes
entry.summary: I give some claims on primorial prime numbers for interested readers in number theory.

entry.title: The Bilateral Vandermonde Convolution
entry.summary: A new and easy way of deriving Gauss's Generalized Hypergeometric Theorem is presented by using the Bilateral Binomial Theorem.

entry.title: Bernoulli-Taylor formula for psi-umbral difference calculus
entry.summary: An expansion formula of a new type with the rest term of Cauchy type is derived in the operator formulation of generalized umbral calculus

entry.title: A prime prime primer
entry.summary: We present a simple, closed formula which gives all the primes in order. It is a simple product of integer floor and ceiling functions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, 0 figures, document created about Sep. '03

entry.title: There are only countably many sets
entry.summary: We prove that Bourbaki's mathematics is incomplete.

entry.title: A New Integral Transform
entry.summary: Using Bauer's expansion and properties of spherical Bessel and Legender functions, we deduce a new transform and briefly indicate its use.

entry.title: Proper congruence-preserving extensions of lattices
entry.summary: We prove that every lattice with more than one element has a proper congruence-preserving extension.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Acta Mathematica Hungarica 85 (1999) 169--179

entry.title: On a Possible Generalization of Fermats Last Theorem
entry.summary: This paper proposes a generalized ABC conjecture and assuming its validity settles a generalized version of Fermats last theorem.

entry.title: Towards commutator theory for relations
entry.summary: In a general algebraic setting, we state some properties of commutators of reflexive admissible relations.

entry.title: Apology of Euclid
entry.summary: This is a short apology of the style of the Elements by Euclid and Bourbaki.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Scientiae Mathematicae Japonicae/Notices from the ISMS, 2006, V.4, No.5, 1-3

entry.title: Recurrence Divisibility Tests
entry.summary: In this note, we are going to introduce some recurrence divisibility tests for all primes except than 2 and 5.

entry.title: A congruence identity satisfied by m-permutable varieties
entry.summary: We present a new and useful congruence identity satisfied by m-permutable varieties.

entry.title: Towards commutator theory for relations. II
entry.summary: We find conditions equivalent to some commutator identities considered in Part I

entry.title: There are Infinitely Many Pairs of Twin Prime
entry.summary: We proved that there are infinitely many pairs of twin prime.

entry.title: There are infinitely many cousin primes
entry.summary: We proved that there are infinitely many cousin primes.

entry.title: A generalization of an inequality from IMO 2005
entry.summary: A generalization of an inequality from IMO is proven.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Mathematics Plus, Vol. 13 (51), No 3 ( 2005), 62-64 (in Bulgarian)

entry.title: An extension of the classical derivative
entry.summary: We extend the usual definition of the derivative in a way that Calculus I students can easily comprehend and which allows calculations at branch points.

entry.title: From Incompleteness Towards Completeness
entry.summary: It is argued that Goedel's incompleteness theorem should be seen as self-evident, rather than unexpected or surprising.

entry.title: Leibniz's Definition of Monad
entry.summary: This is a short discussion of the definition of monad which was given by G.W. Leibniz in his "Monadology."
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: NeuroQuantology, 2006, V. 4, No. 3, 249-251

entry.title: Hilbert's machine and w-order
entry.summary: Hilbert's machine is a supertask machine inspired by Hilbert's Hotel whose functioning leads to a contradictory result involving w-ordering.

entry.title: A Riemann-Farey Computation
entry.summary: An approach to constructing an upper bound for the Riemann-Farey sum is described.

entry.title: Transfinite partitions of Jordan curves
entry.summary: The w-asymmetry induced by transfinite partitions makes it impossible for Jordan curves to have an infinite length.

entry.title: Towards a Hermeneutic Categorical Mathematics or why Category theory goes beyond Mathematical Structuralism
entry.summary: Category theory provides an alternative to Hilbert's Formal Axiomatic method and goes beyond Mathematical Structuralism

entry.title: Bilateral binomial duplication formula
entry.summary: The bilateral binomial theorem with step width two gives a bilateral hypergeometric formula for 2H2(a, a+1/2; c, c+1/2; z).

entry.title: On the minimization of operational risks
entry.summary: We give a risk-minimizing formula for government investments taking into account the zero intelligence law for financial markets.

entry.title: How to compute $\sum 1/n^2$ by solving triangles
entry.summary: A new simple geometric method is presented for finding the exact value of $\sum_{n=1}^\infty 1/n^2$.

entry.title: A Theoretic Proof of the Four Color Theorem
entry.summary: Withdrwan by author

entry.title: Criteria of Primality
entry.summary: In this paper we present four necessary and sufficient conditions for a natural number to be prime.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Gazeta Matematica, Year XXXVI, No. 2, 49-52, 1981

entry.title: Improvement on a Central Theory of PDEs
entry.summary: One of the two basic theorems in [5] on the existence of solutions of PDEs is improved with the use of a group analysis type argument.

entry.title: Another Riemann-Farey Computation
entry.summary: Another approach to constructing an upper bound for the Riemann-Farey sum is described.

entry.title: On Two of Erdös's Open Problems
entry.summary: In this short note we present some remarks and conjectures on two of Erd\"os's open problems in number theory.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Gamma, XXV, Year VIII, No. 3, p. 5, 1986

entry.title: Notes on planar semimodular lattices. I. Construction
entry.summary: We construct all planar semimodular lattices in three simple steps from the direct product of two chains.

entry.title: The Call of Mathematics
entry.summary: A few remarks on how mathematics quests for freedom.
entry.arxiv:comment: A draft of a talk at the conference "Mathematics in the Modern World," Novosibirisk, September 17-23, 2007

entry.title: Six Conjectures which Generalize or Are Related to Andrica's Conjecture
entry.summary: Six conjectures on pairs of consecutive primes are listed in this paper, together with examples for each case.

entry.title: Applications of Wallis Theorem
entry.summary: In this paper we present theorems and applications of Wallis theorem related to trigonometric integrals.

entry.title: Inequalities for Integer and Fractional Parts
entry.summary: In this paper we present 43 new inequalities related to integer part and fractional part.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Octogon Mathematical Magazine, Vol. 14, No. 1, 206-211, 2006

entry.title: Equations in a free group. Elementary theory
entry.summary: We prove the decidability of the elementary theory of a free group.

entry.title: Fillings method in number theory
entry.summary: Number of results in number theory have been developed using a new method. The Goldbach binary conjecture in strengthened formulation have been among them.

entry.title: An Exact Exprsssion of Pi(x)
entry.summary: The author states an exact expression of the distribution of primes.

entry.title: Euler sums and a prime numbers conundrum
entry.summary: This note highlights an interesting connection between Euler sums of even weight and prime numbers.

entry.title: Recursion and w-order
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to an error.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author

entry.title: Superswapping
entry.summary: Supertask theory is used here to prove a contradictory result which involves the consistency of w-order and the Axiom of Infinity.

entry.title: Some applications of the Beta function
entry.summary: This short note deals with some applications of the Beta function

entry.title: On the Collatz Problem
entry.summary: Taking a new approach towards analyzing the Collatz Problem, or, 3x+1 conjecture. Introducing some new functions, the Collatz-2 and Collatz-3 sequences, as well as deducing results related to Collatz-2 and Collatz-3 sequences.

entry.title: Infinite sequences in the framework of classical logic
entry.summary: Infinite sequences are considered in the framework of classical logic from a new point of view.

entry.title: Proving the existence of the $n$th root by induction
entry.summary: In this paper we prove by induction on $n$ that any positive real number has $n$th root.

entry.title: An Introduction to Smooth Infinitesimal Analysis
entry.summary: An exposition of smooth infinitesimal analysis, which is a way to do calculus with nilsquare infinitesimals, is given.

entry.title: About Factorial Sums
entry.summary: Certain new inequalities for the sums of factorials are presented.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Octogon International Mathematical Magazine, Vol 15, No. 2, 810-812, 2007

entry.title: On the Inviscid Burgers Equation and the Axiom of Choice
entry.summary: The article considers the Choice Axiom.

entry.title: Hurwitz's Freeness Property
entry.summary: The groupoid attached to the action of PSL(2,Z) on the irrational reals by linear fractional transformations is free.

entry.title: On the rank of elliptic curves
entry.summary: The paper presents an approach that may lead to a counterexample to the Birch and Swinnerton-Dyer conjecture.

entry.title: The Necessary Structure of Congruences in Free Semigroups
entry.summary: A characterization of congruences in free semigroups is presented.

entry.title: On the Safe Use of Inconsistent Mathematics
entry.summary: A method is presented for using the consistent part of inconsistent axiomatic systems.

entry.title: A proof of the Riemann Hypothesis
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author, due to a crucial error in page 5.

entry.title: Algebraic Elements and Invariant Subspaces
entry.summary: We prove that if a completely non-unitary contraction T in L(H) has a non-trivial algebraic element h, then T has a non-trivial invariant subspace.

entry.title: Prime Reciprocal Digit Frequencies and the Euler Zeta Function
entry.summary: Some open questions related to prime reciprocal digit frequencies with potential applications to cryptography are presented.

entry.title: An interesting temporalization of Gödel's ontological proof
entry.summary: Recent theologies concerning God's death after Auschwitz are mathematically formalized through a suitable temporalization of G\"{o}del's Ontological Proof.

entry.title: Brief Research Notes on Transformation of Series and Special Functions
entry.summary: In this work we derive results concerning Elliptic Functions using as tools general formulas from previus work.

entry.title: A new inequality involving primes
entry.summary: In this note, we find a new inequality involving primes and deduce several Bonse-type inequalities.

entry.title: An elementary proof of the robustness of the linear hyperbolic flows
entry.summary: We present an elementary proof that the qualitative picture of a linear hyperbolic flow is insensitive to slight measurements errors in its associated vector field.

entry.title: On three consecutive primes
entry.summary: In this paper, we prove certain theorems about three consecutive primes.

entry.title: An elementary proof of the uniqueness of the solutions of linear odes
entry.summary: In this note, we present an elementary proof of the uniqueness of the solutions of the initial value problems of linear ordinary differential equations (odes).

entry.title: Pascal's Hexagon Theorem implies a Butterfly Theorem in the Complex Projective Plane
entry.summary: This paper proves a generalization of the Butterfly Theorem, a classical Euclidean result, which is valid in the complex projective plane.

entry.title: Some possible approaches to the Riemann Hypothesis via the Li/Keiper constants
entry.summary: In this paper we consider some possible approaches to the proof of the Riemann Hypothesis using the Li criterion.

entry.title: Beurling spectrum of functions in Banach space
entry.summary: We are interested in Beurling spectrum of $\mathbb X-$valued functions with application in functional delay differential equations.

entry.title: Genaral Pi Function and the Pi number
entry.summary: In this short note, we have defined a new "nested square root" function which generates usual Pi number for $x=2$. We have given some useful identities and asymptotic formulas of the Pi-function.

entry.title: A Group-Pertmutation Algorithm to Solve the Generalized SUDOKU
entry.summary: In this short paper we present an algorithm for finding a solution to a generalized Sudoku.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Recreatii matematice, Ia\'Ei, Romania, 20-22, Nr.1/2011

entry.title: A Generalization of the Idea of Disjunction
entry.summary: We generalize the concept of disjunction.

entry.title: Pantazi's Theorem Regarding the Bi-orthological Triangles
entry.summary: In this article we'll present an elementary proof of a theorem of Alexandru Pantazi (1896-1948), Romanian mathematician, regarding the bi-orthological triangles.

entry.title: Notes On a Continued Fraction of Ramanujan
entry.summary: We study the properties of a general continued fraction of Ramanujan. In some certain cases we evaluate it completely.

entry.title: Parametric Evaluations of the Rogers Ramanujan Continued Fraction
entry.summary: In this article with the help of the inverse function of the singular moduli we evaluate the Rogers Ranmanujan continued fraction and his first derivative.

entry.title: On the existence of exotic homotopy 3-spheres
entry.summary: An elementary argument to show nonexistence.

entry.title: A note on the Hodge conjecture
entry.summary: An approach that may lead to a counterexample to the Hodge conjecture.

entry.title: Two Applications of Desargues' Theorem
entry.summary: In this article we use the Desargues' theorem and its reciprocal to solve two problems.

entry.title: A new proof of Menelaus's Theorem of Hyperbolic Quadrilaterals in the Poincaré Model of Hyperbolic Geometry
entry.summary: In this study we give the hyperbolic version of classical Menelaus theorem for quadrilaterals.

entry.title: A Note On The Spectral Norms of The Matrices Connected Integer Numbers Sequence
entry.summary: In this paper, we compute the spectral norms of the matrices related with integer squences and we give two examples related with Fibonacci and Lucas numbers.

entry.title: Definition and Existence of the Eigenderivative
entry.summary: We define the eigenderivatives of a linear operator on any real or complex Banach space, and give a sufficient condition for their existence.

entry.title: Ramanujan type $1/π$ Approximation Formulas
entry.summary: In this article we use theoretical and numerical methods to evaluate in a closed-exact form the parameters of Ramanujan type $1/\pi$ formulas.

entry.title: A Theorem of Probability
entry.summary: A very simple but useful almost sure convergence theorem of probability is given.

entry.title: Every set has its S-divisor
entry.summary: Admin note: withdrawn by arxiv admin due to use of pseudonym against arXiv policy.
entry.arxiv:comment: Withdrawn by arXiv administration due to policy violation

entry.title: On Fuzzy Boundary
entry.summary: In this paper, we introduce a new type fuzzy boundary and study some related set theoretic identities. Further, this new type of fuzzy boundary is compared with different existing fuzzy boundaries.

entry.title: Some applications of the sine and cosine integrals
entry.summary: We show how the sine and cosine integrals may be usefully employed in the evaluation of some more complex integrals.

entry.title: On an integral involving the digamma function
entry.summary: We consider several possible approaches to evaluating an integral involving the digamma function and a related logarithmic series.

entry.title: Hasse theorem -- an elementary approach
entry.summary: We give an elementary proof to Hasse theorem.

entry.title: The integration theory of linear ordinary differential equations
entry.summary: The Integration Theory of Linear Ordinary Differential Equation.

entry.title: The Faa di Bruno formula revisited
entry.summary: We present a new variant of the Faa di Bruno formula with a simpler summation order.

entry.title: The properties of sendograph metric on fuzzy number spaces
entry.summary: This paper discusses the variation of sendograph distances under some algebra operations.

entry.title: On One Function Defined on the Cartesian Product and Guinness Numbers
entry.summary: New numbers, called Guinness numbers, are introduced using certain function of natural argument. Few problems related to these numbers are formulated.

entry.title: On a new method for calculation of the number of prime numbers in the given interval
entry.summary: Definition of the number of prime numbers in the given interval

entry.title: On Lehmer Binomial Series
entry.summary: We give evaluations in closed form of certain Lehmer-binomial series

entry.title: Note on a Nonlinear Differential Equation
entry.summary: We give evaluations in closed form of certain non linear differential equations

entry.title: Approximation capability of the convolution methods for fuzzy numbers
entry.summary: This paper shows that how to approximate general fuzzy number by using convolution method.

entry.title: A new proof of Vantieghem's theorem
entry.summary: We present a new proof of a primality criterion first proved by Emmanuel Vantieghem.

entry.title: On vector field generated by the Hopf map $S^3$ on $S^2$
entry.summary: The examples of solutions of the system of differential equations generated by the Hopf map $S^3\rightarrow S^2$ are constructed. Their properties are discussed.

entry.title: The geometry of polynomial diagrams
entry.summary: In this paper we introduce the concept of polynomial diagrams and its area for special polynomials.We study the properties of polynomial area diagrams. The formula for the area of an arbitrary polynomial diagram.

entry.title: Advances in Startpoint Theory for quasi-pseudometric spaces
entry.summary: This paper presents some startpoint (endpoint, fixed point) theorems for mutli-valued maps that generalize recent results proved by Y. U. Gaba \cite{rico, ricoo}.

entry.title: On the Complete Evaluation of Jacobi Theta Functions
entry.summary: Using numerical methods we construct evaluation formulas for the Jacobi $\theta_4$ functions. Our results are conjectures, but are verified numerically.

entry.title: A Nonstandard Approach to Equidistribution
entry.summary: Using nonstandard analysis, we generalise a classical result on equidistributions to integrable functions, and give an application of the Weil conjectures for algebraic curves, to equidistribution in characteristic zero.

entry.title: Characterizations of precompact sets in fuzzy star-shaped numbers space with Lp-metric
entry.summary: In this paper, we consider the characterizations of precompact sets in fuzzy star-shaped number space with Lp-metric.

entry.title: Global approximation theorems for general gamma type operators
entry.summary: In this paper, we obtained some global approximation results for general Gamma type operators.

entry.title: Comment "On dual ordered semigroups"
entry.summary: This is about the paper by Thawhat Changphas and Nawamin Phaipong in Quasigroups and Related Systems 22 (2014), 193--200.

entry.title: Curves of Constant Breadth According to Darboux Frame
entry.summary: In this paper, we investigate constant breadth curves on a surface according to Darboux frame and give some characterizations of these curves.

entry.title: Bipolar Neutrosophic Soft Expert Sets
entry.summary: In this paper, we define concept of bipolar neutrosophic soft expert set. Also, its basic operations, namely complement, union and intersection. We give examples for these concepts.

entry.title: Thinking Inside and Outside the Box
entry.summary: I discuss puzzles that require thinking outside the box. I also discuss the box inside of which many people think.

entry.title: Curves with normal planes at constant distance from a fixed point
entry.summary: We consider the curves whose all normal planes are at the same distance from a fixed point and obtain some characterizations of them in the 3-dimensional Euclidean space.

entry.title: On a Certain Function with Negative Coefficients
entry.summary: In what follows we improve an inequality related to matrix theory. T. Laffey proved (2013) a weaker form of this inequality [2].

entry.title: From semigroups to $Γ$-semigroups and to hypersemigroups
entry.summary: This paper serves as an example to show the way we pass from semigroups to $\Gamma$-semigroups and to hypersemigroups.

entry.title: How we pass from semigroups to hypersemigroups
entry.summary: The aim of writing this paper is given in the title. The results on semigroups can be easily transferred to hyper-semigroups in the way indicated in the present paper.

entry.title: PDEs and hypercomplex analytic functions
entry.summary: Hypercomplex numbers are unital algebras over the real numbers. We offer a short demonstration of the practical value of hypercomplex analytic functions in the field of partial differential equations.

entry.title: From ordered semigroups to ordered hypersemigroups
entry.summary: We wrote this paper as an example to show the way we pass from ordered semigroups to ordered hypersemigroups.

entry.title: On Perfectness of Intersection Graph of Ideals of $\mathbb{Z}_n$
entry.summary: In this paper, we characterize the positive integers $n$ for which intersection graph of ideals of $\mathbb{Z}_n$ is perfect.

entry.title: A geometrization of quadratic multi-time Lagrangians
entry.summary: The aim of this paper is to construct a Riemann-Lagrange geometry (in the sense of d-linear connection, d-torsions and d-curvatures) for a quadratic multi-time Lagrangian.

entry.title: Goldbach's Conjecture and Euler's $φ$-Function
entry.summary: In this paper we propose an alternative formulation of the binary and ternary Goldbach conjectures as the systems of equations involving the Euler $\phi$-function.

entry.title: Magic Tours of Knight in 4x4x4 Cube
entry.summary: There are 216 magic tours of knight in 4x4x4 cube.

entry.title: A short proof of the error term in Simpson's rule
entry.summary: In this paper we present a short and elementary proof for the error in Simpson's rule.

entry.title: Constructive fractals in set theory. Tutorial. (In Russian)
entry.summary: Classical geometric fractals - Cantor set and Sierpinski continua - are presented in the manual as set-theoretic objects.

entry.title: The second part of on duality triads' paper
entry.summary: The duality triads were defined in the preceding paper.(ArXiv: math.GM/0402260 v 1 Feb. 2004). Notation, enumeration of formulas and references is therefore to be continued hereby. In this paper Fibonomial triangle and further Pascal-like triangles including q-Gaussian one are given explicit interpretation as discrete time dynamical systems as it is the case with all duality triads.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Bull. Soc. Sci. Lett. Lodz Ser. Rech. Deform. 53, Ser. Rech.Deform. 42 (2002) pp.25-37

entry.title: Some remarks on autoequivalences of categories
entry.summary: Prof. Boris I. Plotkin [arXiv:math.GM/0210194, arXiv:math.GM/0204245] drew attention to the question when an equivalence between two categories is isomorphic as a functor to an isomorphism between them. It turns out that it is quite important for universal algebraical geometry and concerns mainly the categories $\Theta \sp 0 (X) $ of free universal algebras of some variety $\Theta $ free generated by finite subsets of $X$. In the paper, a complete answer to the Plotkin's question is given: there are no proper autoequivalences of the category $\Theta \sp 0 (X) $. Also some connected problems are discussed.

entry.title: On automorphisms of categories of universal algebras
entry.summary: A new approach is suggested to characterize algebraically automorphisms of the category of free algebras of a given variety. It gives in many cases an answer to the problem set by the first of authors, if automorphisms of such a category are inner or not. This question is important for universal algebraic geometry [arXiv:math. GM\slash 0210187],[arXiv:math. GM\slash 0210194]. Most of results are actually valid for arbitrary categories with a represented forgetful functor.

author.name: Boris Plotkin
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Mathematics, Hebrew University, Jerusalem, Israel

author.name: Grigori Zhitomirski
author.arxiv:affiliation: Department of Mathematics, Bar-Ilan University, Israel

entry.arxiv:comment: 24 pages. Connected to math.GM/0403394, math.GM/0210187, math.GM/0210194

entry.title: Four multiplicative cohomology theorems
entry.summary: I try to find natural statement and proof of the de Rham Theorem and of other cohomology theorems.

entry.title: A lemma on the minimal surfaces
entry.summary: Stated lemma contains the assertions about isomorphism of exact m-forms and exterior differentials of regular m-maps, of linearly harmonic m-forms and exterior differentials of regular harmonic m-maps, of global minimal (n-m)-surfaces and level (n-m)-surfaces of regular minimal m-maps. It hold in n-dimensional Euclidean space.

entry.title: A Proof of "Goldbach's Conjecture"
entry.summary: "Goldbach's Conjecture" proven by analysis of how all combinations of the odd primes, summed in pairs, generates all of the even numbers.

entry.title: On the generation of linear groups by combinatoric groups
entry.summary: It is described the group of arrowy permutations (that is extension of symmetric group) and the consequent process of generation of GL(n) and some its subgroups by this combinatoric group and its subgroups.

entry.title: On some mathematical construction of many-dimensional cosmos
entry.summary: It is shown that classical Clifford algebras are group algebras of cyclic subgroups of arrowy rermutations. It is established that Euclidean 3-space, Pauli and Dirac algebras and groups of global guage transformations are corollary from the geometry of 8-dimensional vacuum and 9-dimensional cosmos.

entry.title: On the interior structure of exterior algebra
entry.summary: It is constructed the functor from category of product linear space to category of skew-symmetric tensor space. It is defined and described the bound bundle as analog of a symplex and as basis element of new constructive homology theory.

entry.title: Density preserving functions
entry.summary: The property that a one to one function from the natural numbers to itself preserves the density of sub-sets is shown to be equivalent to a condition on the covering of intervals in the range of the function by images of intervals in the domain of the function.

entry.title: Neutrosophy
entry.summary: Neutrosophy is a new branch of philosophy which studies the origin, nature, and scope of neutralities, as well as their interactions with different ideational spectra.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: "Neutrosophy. / Neutrosophic Probability, Set, and Logic", book by Florentin Smarandache, American Research Press, Rehoboth, 1998

entry.title: Special Algebraic Structures
entry.summary: New notions are introduced in algebra in order to better study the congruences in number theory. For example, the <special semigroups> makes an important such contribution.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: "Collected Papers", Vol. III, book by Florentin Smarandache, Abaddaba, Oradea, 2000

entry.title: Numerology
entry.summary: One presents many Concatenated and Operation Sequences, P-Q Relationships, Digital Sequences, Magic Squares, Prime Conjectures, k-Divisibility and Strong Divisibility Sequences, Geometric Conjectures, Proposed problems.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages. Tables of numbers. Presented to the Pedagogical High School Student Conference in Craiova, 1969

entry.title: Thirty-Six Unsolved Problems in Number Theory
entry.summary: Partially or totally unsolved questions in number theory and geometry especially, such as coloration problems, elementary geometric conjectures, partitions, generalized periods of a number, length of a generalized period, arithmetic and geometric progressions are exposed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 38 pages, Published in "Only Problems, Not Solutions!", by Florentin Smarandache, Xiquan Publ. Hse., Phoeix, 1991

entry.title: Stochastic processes on non-Archimedean spaces. I. Stochastic processes on Banach spaces
entry.summary: Non-Archimedean analogs of Markov quasimeasures and stochastic processes are investigated. Thery are used for the development of stochastic antiderivations. The non-Archimedean analog of the It$\hat o$ formula is proved.

entry.title: Intrinsic palindromic numbers
entry.summary: We introduce a notion of palindromicity of a natural number which is independent of the base. We study the existence and density of palindromic and multiple palindromic numbers, and we raise several related questions.

entry.title: White Hole, Black Whole, and The Book
entry.summary: Intellectual space is defined as the set of all proofs of mathematical logic, contained in The Book conceived by Erdos. Physical and intellectual spaces are visualized, making use of concepts from intuitive set theory.

entry.title: Rapid growth sequences
entry.summary: Studying Fermat sequence we can simply find infinitely many other rapidly growing sequences of similar properties. On the other hand this approach allows us simple construction of such sequences.

entry.title: The Banach-Tarski paradox or what mathematics and religion have in common
entry.summary: We give a popular account of the Banach-Tarski paradox and its connections with the axiom of choice.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages; intended for high school students and teachers
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Pi in the Sky 2 (2000), 13-15

entry.title: A Generator System of Invariant differential forms
entry.summary: We obtain a generator system of the algebra of $\mathrm{GL}(V)$-invariant differential forms on $\mathrm{End}_{\bf k} (V)$. The proof uses the Weyl-Schur reciprocity.
entry.arxiv:comment: (from arXiv administration) Prank submission from Yoshinaga Masahiko <math-ys@kusm.kyoto-u.ac.jp>, 3 pages

entry.title: Oscillating Population Models
entry.summary: Oscillating population model realistic situations in different contexts.We examine this situation with reasonable mathematical models and come to interesting conclusions,such as for example,that the population at most points of the cycle approximately equals half the maximum attainable population.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, TeX, Paper submitted to Chaos, Solitons and Fractals

entry.title: On the Root Ambiguity in the Complete Solution to the Most General Fifth Degree Polynomial
entry.summary: Starting from the solution to Bring's equation the root ambiguity is removed from the solution to the quintic equation. This gives the five complex roots of the quintic equation as indicated by Gauss's Fundamental Theorem of Algebra.r

entry.title: On a Linear Property of Bilinearly Defined Sets in $\mathbb{R}^n$
entry.summary: Certain types of bilinearly defined sets in $\mathbb{R}^n$ exhibit a higher degree of linearity than what is apparent by inspection.

entry.title: A proof of the non existence of Frey curves without using TSW theorem
entry.summary: Fermat's Last Theorem (FLT) implies that the Frey curves do not exist. A proof of FLT independent of proved Taniyama-Shimura-Weil conjecture is presented.

entry.title: A Geometric Proof of Riemann Hypothesis
entry.summary: Beginning from the formal resolution of Riemann Zeta function, by using the formula of inner product between two infinite-dimensional vectors in the complex space, the author proved the world's baffling problem -- Riemann hypothesis raised by German mathematician B. Riemann in 1859.

entry.title: A Geometric Proof of Generalized Riemann Hypothesis
entry.summary: Beginning from the resolution of Dirichlet L function, using the inner product formula of infinite-dimensional vectors in the complex space, the author proved the world's baffling problem--Generalized Riemann hypothesis.

entry.title: The n-dimensional Cube--A New Way to Prove the Fermat's Last Theorem
entry.summary: By studying the n-dimensional cube, the author finds a new way, and use it to proves that the indefinite equation $x^n+y^n=z^n(n=>3)$ has no any solutions of positive integers.

entry.title: A Geometric Proof of the Hecke Conjecture
entry.summary: Beginning from the resolution of the Dirichlet L function, using the inner product formula between two infinite-dimensional vectors in the complex space, the author proved the baffling problem--Hecke conjecture.

entry.title: The Riemann Hypothesis is Unprovable
entry.summary: In this note, we give a simple proof that the Riemann Hypothesis is unprovable in any reasonable axiom system.

entry.title: Geometrical equivalence, geometrical similarity and geometrical compatibility of algebras
entry.summary: In the paper the main attention is paid to conditions on algebras from a given variety which provide coincidence of their algebraic geometries. The main part here play the notions mentioned in the title of the paper.

entry.title: Transformations of Grassman Spaces
entry.summary: This is a version of a part of the book ``Transformations of Grassman Spaces'' (in progress). We study transformations of Grassman spaces preserving certain geometrical constructions related to buildings. The next part will be devoted to Grassman spaces associated with polar spaces.

entry.title: A Function in the Congruence Theory
entry.summary: In this paper we define a function $L$ which will allow us to (separately or simultaneously) generalize many theorems from Number Theory obtained by Wilson, Fermat, Euler, Gauss, Lagrange, Leibniz, Moser, and Sierpinski.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Published in Libertas Mathematica, University of Texas at Arlington, Vol. XII, pp. 181-185, 1992

entry.title: A new formula for the nth prime
entry.summary: Formula for the nth prime using elementary arithmetical functions based in a previous formula changing the characteristic function of prime numbers.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Smarandace Notions Journal Vol. 15 2005

entry.title: Smarandache Function Applied to Perfect Numbers
entry.summary: In this article we see that the value takes the Smarandache Function when it is applied to a perfect number.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Smarandache Notions Journal Vol. 10, Spring 1999 page 114

entry.title: A Functional Recurrence to obtain the Prime Numbers using the Smarandache Prime Function
entry.summary: In this article we gave a recurrence to obtain the n-th prime number as function of the (n-1)-th prime number.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Smarandache Notions Journal. Vol. 11 No. 1-2-3 Spring 2000 p. 56

entry.title: A congruence with the Euler totient function
entry.summary: In this article we give a result obtained of an experimental way for the Euler totient function.

entry.title: A survey of recent results on congruence lattices of lattices
entry.summary: We review recent results on congruence lattices of (inﬁnite) lattices. We discuss results obtained with box products, as well as categorical, ring-theoretical, and topological results.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Algebra Universalis 48, no. 4 (2002) 439--471

entry.title: A survey of tensor products and related constructions in two lectures
entry.summary: We survey tensor products of lattices with zero and related constructions focused on two topics: amenable lattices and box products.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Algebra Universalis 45, no. 2/3 (2001) 117--134

entry.title: Gitterwege reeller Zahlen
entry.summary: Let r be a real number, 0<r<1, given as a dual number. With the sequence of "0", "1" we define a path in a hexagonal lattice. Relations between the properties of r and its path are considered. Generalisations to other bases and lattices.

entry.title: The Classical Smarandache Function and a Formula for Twin Primes
entry.summary: This short paper presents an exact formula for counting twin prime pairs less than or equal to x in terms of the classical Smarandache Function. An extension of the formula to count prime pairs (p, p+2n), n > 1, is also given.

entry.title: An arguable addition to the standard Deduction Theorems of first order theories
entry.summary: We consider the immediate consequence of an arguable addition to the standard Deduction Theorems of first order theories.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages; an HTML version is available at http://alixcomsi.com/An_arguable_addition.htm

entry.title: Projection representable relations on Menger $(2,n)$-semigroups
entry.summary: In this paper relations of non-empty intersection, inclusion end equality of domains of functions for $(2,n)$-semigroups of partial $n$-place functions are investigated.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Czechoslovak Math J 58(133) (2008), 1015-1037

entry.title: Remark on Cavalieri's Quadrature Formula
entry.summary: Every calculus student learns Cavalieri's quadrature formula for the antiderivative of x^n (integer n). We observe here that the logarithmic (n=-1) case implies all the others.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: The American Mathematical Monthly, Vol. 110, No. 5, May 2003, p. 437

entry.title: Refinement of Inequalities among Means
entry.summary: In this paper we shall consider some famous means such as arithmetic, harmonic, geometric, root-square means, etc. Some new means recently studied are also presented. Different kinds of refinement of inequalities among these means are given.

entry.title: On Cantor's Theorem
entry.summary: The famous contradiction of a bijection between a set and its power set is a consequence of the impredicative definition involved. This is shown by the fact that a simple mapping between equivalent sets does also fail to satisfy the critical requirement.

entry.title: On the Gaps between Two Consecutive Prime Numbers
entry.summary: In this article, a relation between a gap $d_{k}$ and divisors of composite numbers between $p_{k}$ and $p_{k+1}$ is established.
entry.arxiv:comment: Withdrawn; this is simply a complicated way of rephrasing the elementary Greek sieve

entry.title: Divisibility tests with weighted digital sums
entry.summary: We propose a divisibility test for all integers which have 1, 3, 7 or 9 in their unit's place. In particular, then, the test applies for all prime divisors except 2 and 5.

entry.title: The Mechanist's Challenge
entry.summary: Did we really hope to get away with The Goedelian Argument? A critical response to J. R. Lucas' 1996 articulation of his 1961 argument.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages; an HTML version is available at http://alixcomsi.com/The Mechanist's Challenge.htm

entry.title: The Goebbellian Syndrome
entry.summary: Can we really falsify truth by dictat? A critical note on J. R. Lucas' 1996 remarks concerning non-standard models of first-order Peano Arithmetic.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages; an HTML version is available at http://alixcomsi.com/The Goebbellian Syndrome.htm

entry.title: On the Possible Monoid Structures of the Natural Numbers N, or Finding All Associative Binary Operations on N
entry.summary: A certain analysis of all possible associative binary operations on N is presented. This is equivalent with an analysis of all possible monoid structures on N. Several results and a conjecture in this regard are given.

entry.title: There is at least one pair of double primes for any even number
entry.summary: We proved that any even number not less than 6 can be expressed as the sum of two old primes, $2n=p_i+p_j$

entry.title: On Algebraic Multi-Ring Spaces
entry.summary: A Smarandache multi-space is a union of $n$ spaces $A_1,A_2,..., A_n$ with some additional conditions holding. Combining Smarandache multi-spaces with rings in classical ring theory, the conception of multi-ring spaces is introduced. Some characteristics of a multi-ring space are obtained in this paper.

entry.title: On Multi-Vector Spaces
entry.summary: A Smarandache multi-space is a union of $n$ spaces $A_1,A_2,..., A_n$ with some additional conditions holding. Combining Smarandache multi-spaces with linear vector spaces in classical linear algebra, the conception of multi-vector spaces is introduced. Some characteristics of a multi-vector space are obtained in this paper.

entry.title: On Multi-Metric Spaces
entry.summary: A Smarandache multi-space is a union of $n$ spaces $A_1,A_2,..., A_n$ with some additional conditions holding. Combining Smarandache multi-spaces with classical metric spaces, the conception of multi-metric space is introduced. Some characteristics of a multi-metric space are obtained and Banach's fixed-point theorem is generalized in this paper.

entry.title: Naive Philosophical Foundations
entry.summary: This soliloquy outlines some naive philosophical arguments underlying the thesis that mathematics ought to be viewed simply as a universal set of languages, some of precise expression, and some of effective communication.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages; an HTML version is available at http://alixcomsi.com/Naive_Philosophical_Foundations.htm

entry.title: On angles formed by $N$ points of the Euclidean and Hyperbolic planes
entry.summary: We solve the problem of finding a sharp upper bound on the minimum angle formed by $N$ points in the Euclidean and Hyperbolic planes.

entry.title: Fibonacci-Lucas densities
entry.summary: Both Fibonacci and Lucas numbers can be described combinatorially in terms of 0-1 strings without consecutive ones. In the present article we explore the occupation numbers as well as the correlations between various positions in the corresponding configurations.

entry.title: Beyond Undecidable
entry.summary: The predicate complementary to the well-known Godel's provability predicate is defined. From its recursiveness new consequences concerning the incompleteness argumentation are drawn and extended to new results of consistency, completeness and decidability with regard to Peano Arithmetic and the first order predicate calculus.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, for more information see http://it.geocities.com/paola_cattabriga/

entry.title: A note on primes dividing alternating sums
entry.summary: We define A_n=\sum_{i=1}^n (-1)^i\frac{1}{i} and we show that, for every prime p, there exists a number n such that A_n\equiv 0 (mod p).

entry.title: Introducing bisemistructures
entry.summary: New fundamental mathematical structures are introduced by the triples (left semistructure,right semistructure,bisemistructure) associated with the classical mathematical structures and such that the bisemistructures,resulting from the reciprocal actions of left semistructures on right semistructures,are composed of bielements which are either diagonal bielements or cross bielements.

entry.title: Solving General Equations by Order Completion
entry.summary: A method based on order completion for solving general equations is presented. In particular, this method can be used for solving large classes of nonlinear systems of PDEs, with possibly associated initial and/or boundary value problems.

entry.title: Extending Mappings between Posets
entry.summary: A variety of possible extensions of mappings between posets to their Dedekind order completion is presented. One of such extensions has recently been used for solving large classes of nonlinear systems of partial differential equations with possibly associated initial and/or boundary value problems.

entry.title: Difficulties with Learning and Teaching Calculus
entry.summary: Several thoughts are presented on the long ongoing difficulties both students and academics face related to Calculus 101. Some of these thoughts may have a more general interest.

entry.title: Effective prime factors and Goldbach's Theorem/Conjecture
entry.summary: According to the similarity theorem on the distributions of the effective prime factors and by using two-part method, Goldbach theorem and, consequently, Goldbach conjecture was proved.

entry.title: On the mathematical modelling of measurement
entry.summary: The operations of linear algebra, calculus, and statistics are routinely applied to measurement scales but certain mathematical conditions must be satisfied in order for these operations to be applicable. We call attention to the conditions that lead to construction of measurement scales that enable these operations.

entry.title: Correcting a minor error in Cantor's calculation of the power of the continuum
entry.summary: Cantor's algebraic calculation of the power of the continuum contains an easily repairable error related to Cantor own way of defining the addition of cardinal numbers. The appropriate correction is suggested.

entry.title: On tolerances representable as $R \circ R^-$
entry.summary: We give examples and counterexamples concerning varieties in which every tolerance is representable as $R \circ R^-$, for some reflexive and admissible relation $R$.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Expanded and published in Acta Sci. Math. (Szeged) 73 (2007), no. 1-2, 31--51

entry.title: A Generalization of Euler's Theorem on Congruencies
entry.summary: We present a theorem which generalizes the classical Euler's theorem on congruencies: if $(a,m)=1$ then $a^ \phi(m) \equiv 1 (mod m)$ for the case when $a$ and $m$ are not relatively primes.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: "Bulet. Univ. Brasov," Series C, Vol. XXIII, pp. 7-12, 1981

entry.title: Generalizations of Ceva's Theorem and Applications
entry.summary: Three generalizations of the well-known Ceva's Theorem are given in this paper and some applications.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Published in author's book "Generalisations et Generalites" [French], pp. 15-20, Edition Nouvelle, Fes, Morocco, 1984

entry.title: Junction Conditions, Resolution of Singularities and Nonlinear Equations of Physics
entry.summary: For large classes of systems of polynomial nonlinear PDEs necessary and sufficient conditions are given for the existence of solutions which are discontinuous across hyper-surfaces. These PDEs contain the Navier-Stokes equations, as well as those of General Relativity and Magneto-Hydrodynamics.

entry.title: Erlang's loss function and a property of the exponential function
entry.summary: We show that a concavity property of the exponential function is a direct consequence of the convexity of the continued Erlang loss function.

entry.title: A Class of Recursive Sets
entry.summary: In this article one builds a class of recursive sets, one establishes properties of these sets, and one proposes applications.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: In G\'en\'eralisations et G\'en\'eralit\'es, by F. Smarandache, Ed. Nouvelle, F\`es, pp. 27-32, 1984

entry.title: K-Nomial Coefficients
entry.summary: In this paper one extends the binomial and trinomial coefficients to the concept of 'k-nomial' coefficients, and one obtains some properties of these. As an application one generalizes Pascal's triangle.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: In G\'en\'eralisations et G\'en\'eralit\'es, by F. Smarandache, Ed. Nouvelle, F\`es, pp. 24-26, 1984

entry.title: Deducibility Theorems in Boolean Logic
entry.summary: In this paper we give two theorems from the Propositional Calculus of the Boolean Logic with their consequences and applications and we prove them axiomatically.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Analele Univ. Timisoara, Seria St. Matematice, Vol. XVII, Fasc. 2, pp. 164-168, 1979

entry.title: Negative dimension in general and asymptotic topology
entry.summary: We introduce the notion of negative topological dimension and the notion of weight for the asymptotic topological dimension. Quantizing of spaces of negative dimension is applied to linguistic statistics.

entry.title: Periodic continued fractions and hyperelliptic curves
entry.summary: We consider a special class of periodic continued fractions (called alpha-fractions) and discuss the related algebraic and geometric problems. A classical description of the Jacobi variety of a hyperelliptic curve due to Jacobi naturally appears in this context.

entry.title: Algorithms for Solving Linear Congruences and Systems of Linear Congruences
entry.summary: In this article we determine several theorems and methods for solving linear congruences and systems of linear congruences, and we find the number of distinct solutions. Many examples of solving congruences are given.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Gamma, Year X, Nos. 1-2, 1987

entry.title: Bases of Solutions for Linear Congruences
entry.summary: In this article we establish some properties regarding the solutions of a linear congruence, bases of solutions of a linear congruence, and the finding of other solutions starting from these bases.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Bulletin of the University of Brasov, Series C, Vol. XXII, 25-31, 1980

entry.title: On Diophantine Equation $x^2 = 2y^4-1$
entry.summary: In this short note we present a method of solving this Diophantine equation, method which is different from Ljunggren's, Mordell's, and R.K.Guy's.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Gamma, Year IX, No. 1, p. 12, 1986

entry.title: Proof of the Goldbach conjecture in a more stringent form
entry.summary: With an artificial (p', n')-system it has been proved that even numbers > (p(x))^2 are the sum of two p > p(x).
entry.arxiv:comment: Changes in version 2: some minor additions and replacements for clarification on pp. 2, 4, and 5

entry.title: A procedure for finding the k-th power of a matrix
entry.summary: We give a new procedure in Maple for finding the k-th power of a martix. The algorithm is based on the article [1].

entry.title: Representation Of Level Paths Of An Analytic Function
entry.summary: We find an arc-parameterization of the contour on which an given analytic function has constant modulus. This contour is seen to satisfy a differential equation which we explicitly give.

entry.title: The General Form Of Cyclic Orthonormal Generators In R^N
entry.summary: In this paper we give a definition of cyclic orthonormal generators (cogs) in R^N. We give a general canonical form for their expression. Further, we give an explicit formula for computing the canonical form of any given cog.

entry.title: The Riemann hypothesis - an elementary analytic approach based on complex Laplace transform
entry.summary: An elementary analytic proof of the famous Riemann hypothesis is given. The main "accent" of the proof is a both using of the 2-dimensional double real and complex Laplace integral representations of the Green function $\mid z \mid^{-2}$.

entry.title: A system for constructing relatively small polyhedra from Sonobé modules
entry.summary: We develop a quite elementary graph theoretic system for designing small-size augmented origami polyhedra out of Sonob\'e modules beginning with a (convex or not) deltahedron.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: British Origami Issue 245 August 2007

entry.title: Implicit function density computation
entry.summary: If two random variables X and A are functionally related via f(X)=A for some strictly monotone continuously differentiable function f:R->R, the distribution of X may easily be computed from the distribution of A.
entry.arxiv:comment: Added references and minor formatting edits

entry.title: The concrete theory of numbers : Problem of simplicity of Fermat number-twins
entry.summary: The problem of simplicity of Fermat number-twins $f_{n}^{\pm}=2^{2^n}\pm3$ is studied. The question for what $n$ numbers $f_{n}^{\pm}$ are composite is investigated. The factor-identities for numbers of a kind $x^2 \pm k $ are found.

entry.title: An Infinite Family of Quadratic Quadrinomial APN Functions
entry.summary: We present an infinite family of quadratic APN functions on a finite field of dimension over GF(2) divisible by 3.

entry.title: Conjectures on Partitions of Integers as Summations of Primes
entry.summary: In this short note we present a class of conjectures on partitions of integers as summations of primes, which are extensions of Goldbach conjecture.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Published in "Collected Papers", Vol. II, by F. Smarandache, Moldova State University Press at Kishinev, p. 190, 1997

entry.title: About the Characteristic Function of a Set
entry.summary: In this paper we give a method, based on the characteristic function of a set, to solve some difficult problems of set theory in undergraduate research.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Octogon, Vol. 6, No. 2, 86-96, 1998

entry.title: A Fixed Point Conjecture
entry.summary: Inverse limits, unlike direct limits, can in general be void, [1]. The existence of fixed points for arbitrary mappings $T : X \longrightarrow X$ is conjectured to be equivalent with the fact that related direct limits of all finite partitions of X are not void.

entry.title: A Problem in Categories
entry.summary: The problem is posed to find out for arbitrary nonvoid sets $X$ which are all the mappings $T : X \longrightarrow X$ that can be defined and each separately identified through means of categories alone. As argued, this problem may have a certain foundational relevance.

entry.title: One page proof of the Riemann hypothesis
entry.summary: We give a short Wiener measure proof of the Riemann hypothesis based on a surprising, unexpected and deep relation between the Riemann zeta $\zeta(s)$ and the trivial zeta $\zeta_{t}(s):=Im(s)(2Re(s)-1)$.

entry.title: The Infinite in Sciences and Arts
entry.summary: Actual infinity in its various forms is discussed, searched and not found.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk presented at MACAS II, Odense, May 2007
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. 2nd International Symposium of Mathematics and its Connections to the Arts and Sciences, Univ. South. Denmark, Odense 2008, p. 265 - 272.

entry.title: A Generalization of A Leibniz Geometrical Theorem
entry.summary: In this article we present a generalization of a Leibniz's geometrical theorem and an application of it.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Octogon Mathematical Magazine, Vol. 6, No. 1, 67-70, 1998

entry.title: Number of binomial coefficients divided by a fixed power of a prime
entry.summary: We state a general formula for the number of binomial coefficients $n$ choose $k$ that are divided by a fixed power of a prime $p$, i.e., the number of binomial coefficients divided by $p^j$ and not divided by $p^{j+1}$.

entry.title: Poincare's Conjecture for three manifolds
entry.summary: We prove Poincare's Conjecture that every simply connected, closed three-manifold is topologically equivalent to the three-sphere. The proof is founded on the algebraic formulation discovered by J. Stallings.

entry.title: The Lindelof Hypothesis for almost all Hurwitz's Zeta-Functions holds True
entry.summary: By Probability theory, that is, by a kind of quasi-law of the iterated logarithm, we prove the title claim.

entry.title: A Note on Testing of Hypothesis
entry.summary: In this paper, a problem of testing is discussed when the samples have been drawn from the normal distribution. The study of hypothesis testing is also extended to Baye's set up.

entry.title: Fermats Last Theorem on Topological Fields
entry.summary: Even though flt is a number theoretic result we prove that the result depends on the topological as well as the field structure of the underlying space.

entry.title: A note on three dimensional good sets
entry.summary: We show that as in the case of n- fold Cartesian product for n greater than or equal to 4, even in 3-fold Cartesian product, a related component of a good set need not be a full component.

entry.title: Archimedean Type Conditions in Categories
entry.summary: Two concepts of being Archimedean are defined for arbitrary categories.

entry.title: Differentiating polynomials, and zeta(2)
entry.summary: We study the derivatives of polynomials with equally spaced zeros and find connections to the values of the Riemann zeta-function at the positive even integers.

entry.title: Triangle angles and sides in progression and the diophantine equation x^2+3y^2 =z^2
entry.summary: The main result of this paper, is the complete parametric description of the family of triangles which have integer sidelengths and with one angle being sixty degrees.

entry.title: Structural Dynamics of Various Causes of Migration in Jaipur
entry.summary: Various social causes for migration in Jaipur are studied and statistical hypotheses are made in this paper.
entry.arxiv:comment: 22 pages, many statistical graphs and tables

entry.title: The Aleph-zero or zero dichotomy
entry.summary: This paper proves the existence of a dichotomy which being formally derived from the topological successiveness of w-order leads to the same absurdity of Zeno's Dichotomy II. It also derives a contradictory result from the first Zeno's Dichotomy.

entry.title: A disturbing supertask
entry.summary: This paper examines the consistency of w-order by means of a supertask that functions as a supertrap for the assumed existence of w-ordered collections, which are simultaneously complete (as is required by the Actual infinity) and uncompletable (because no last element completes them).

entry.title: A summation by Gencev
entry.summary: Gencev has recently reported a closed form summation for an infinite series involving the harmonic numbers and the central binomial numbers. This note indicates a possible approach to the proof involving the dilogarithm function.

entry.title: A Note on Fuzzy Real and Complex Field
entry.summary: Using the concept of fuzzy field, we have considered the fuzzy field of real and complex numbers and thereafter we have established a few standard results of real and complex numbers with respect to a membership function.

entry.title: The Iterative Simplicity of Basic Topological Operations
entry.summary: Semigroups generated by topological operations such as closure, interior or boundary are considered. It is noted that some of these semigroups are in general finite and noncommutative. The problem is formulated whether they are always finite.

entry.title: On Some Discrete Differential Equations
entry.summary: In this short note, we present few results on the use of the discrete Laplace transform in solving first and second order initial value problems of discrete differential equations.
entry.arxiv:comment: This is a short note on the Discrete Laplace Transform

entry.title: Ambiguity theory, old and new
entry.summary: This is a introductory survey of some recent developments of "Galois ideas" in Arithmetic, Complex Analysis, Transcendental Number Theory and Quantum Field Theory, and of some of their interrelations.

entry.title: Truth as value and duty: lessons of mathematics
entry.summary: I discuss some connotations of mathematical notion of "truth" in the context of humanistic discourse
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pp. Talk at the International Symposium of the Balzan Foundation "Truth in the Humanities, Science and Religion", Lugano, May 16-17, 2008

entry.title: The Antinomy of the Liar and Provability
entry.summary: This work evidences that a sentence cannot be denominated by P and written as P IS NOT TRUE. It demonstrates that in a system in which Q denominates the sentence Q IS NOT PROVABLE it is not provable that Q is true and not provable.

entry.title: Spectrum of analytic continuation
entry.summary: I will show that operator of analytic (harmonic) continuation on a lattice graph has a positive spectrum. I use a theorem about positivity of eigenvalues of totally positive matrices. I conjecture that by approximation the similar result holds in continuous case on a plane.

entry.title: Modern Set
entry.summary: In this paper, we intend to generalize the classical set theory as much as possible. we will do this by freeing sets from the regular properties of classical sets; e.g., the law of excluded middle, the law of non-contradiction, the distributive law, the commutative law,etc....

entry.title: Three-dimensional compact manifolds and the Poincare conjecture
entry.summary: The aim of the work is to prove the following main theorem. Theorem. Let M3 be a three-dimensional, connected, simple-connected, closed, compact, smooth manifold. Tnen the manifold M3 is diffeomorphic to the three-dimensional sphere.

entry.title: Play Ground for Victor's Magic Squares
entry.summary: This article presents a new development of magic squares with a simple set up.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a crucial sign error in one of the proof of this paper

entry.title: Cutting Cakes Correctly
entry.summary: Without additional hypotheses, Proposition 7.1 in Brams and Taylor's book "Fair Division" (Cambridge University Press, 1996) is false, as are several related Pareto-optimality theorems of Brams, Jones and Klamler in their 2006 cake-cutting paper.

entry.title: A Counter Example To the Hodge Conjecture
entry.summary: In this paper, we give a simple counter example to the famous Hodge conjecture.

entry.title: The Gauss-Dirichlet Orbit Number
entry.summary: Dirichlet computed in some particular cases the number of equivalence classes of representations of a nonzero integer by a representative system for the integral binary quadratic forms of a given discriminant. We complete this computation.
entry.arxiv:comment: I changed one word in the abstract

entry.title: About Bernoulli's Numbers
entry.summary: In this article we present a simple proof of Borevich-Shafarevich's method to compute the sum of the first n natural numbers of the same power. We also prove several properties of Bernoulli's numbers.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Oct. Int. Math. J., Vol. 7, No. 1, 151-3, 1999

entry.title: About Very Perfect Numbers
entry.summary: In this short paper we prove that the square of an odd prime number cannot be a very perfect number.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Octogon International Magazine, Vol. 5, No.2, 53-54, 1997

entry.title: Consistency Spaces
entry.summary: We introduce the concept of a consistency space. The idea of the consistency space is motivated by the question, Given only the collection of sets of sentences which are logically consistent, is it possible to reconstruct their lattice structure?

entry.title: Collective Property of Numbers and Its Mathematical Refutation
entry.summary: A number has the "collective" property if the number is the greatest lower bound of a bounded, strictly decreasing sequence on the real line. We prove that numbers with the collective property constitute an empty set.

entry.title: On a class of entire functions, all the zeros of which are real
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author, due to an error in the inequality after the inequality (31).

entry.title: Seven Conjectures in Geometry and Number Theory
entry.summary: In this short paper we propose four conjectures in synthetic geometry that generalize Erdos-Mordell Theorem, and three conjectures in number theory that generalize Fermat Numbers.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: In author's book Collected Papers, Vol. II, University of Chisinau Press, Chisinau, 1997

entry.title: Concerning Riemann Hypothesis
entry.summary: We present a quantum mechanical model which establishes the veracity of the Riemann hypothesis that the non-trivial zeros of the Riemann zeta-function lie on the critical line of $\zeta(s)$.

entry.title: Optimum Statistical Test Procedure
entry.summary: In this paper we obtain a test which minimizes the sum of the two error probabilities irrespective of whether $\sigma^2$ is known or unknown.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Italian Journal of Pure and Applied Mathematics, No. 26, 189-198, 2009

entry.title: Brief Lecture Notes on Self-Referential Mathematics, and Beyond
entry.summary: Recently delivered lectures on Self-Referential Mathematics, [2], at the Department of Mathematics and Applied Mathematics, University of Pretoria, are briefly presented. Comments follow on the subject, as well as on Inconsistent Mathematics.

entry.title: Flag Foliations Functionals. The Hopf Hypothesis
entry.summary: With the help of a new type of functionals we study manifolds diffeomorphic to $S^2\times S^2$ and establish, in particular, the Hopf conjecture.

entry.title: On the Jacobian conjecture
entry.summary: We show that the Jacobian conjecture of the two dimensional case is true.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Pioneer J. Math. and Math. Sci. Vol. 2 (2011), 101-111

entry.title: Higher order fractional derivatives
entry.summary: Based on the Liouville-Weyl definition of the fractional derivative, a new direct fractional generalization of higher order derivatives is presented. It is shown, that the Riesz and Feller derivatives are special cases of this approach.

entry.title: Brief Notes on Sheaves Theory
entry.summary: Essentials of sheaves are briefly presented, followed by related comments on presheaves, bundles, manifolds and singularities, aiming to point to their differences not only in their different formal mathematical structures, but also in the very purposes for which they were introduced in the first place.

entry.title: Research note on a well posed integral used in Apery's proof for the irrationality of Z(3)
entry.summary: In this note we evaluate multiple integrals that play a crucial role in the theory of irrationality of zeta function

entry.title: Sufficient conditions for the invariant Subspace Problem
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author, since the author does not have enough time to answer every questions on this result.

entry.title: A Method of Solving Certain Nonlinear Diophantine Equations
entry.summary: In this paper we propose a method of solving a Nonlinear Diophantine Equation by converting it into a System of Diophantine Linear Equations.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: In author's book "Collected Papers", Vol. 1, Tempus, Bucharest, pp. 54-55, 1996

entry.title: The general solution of Schrodigers differential equation
entry.summary: In this note we solve theoretically the Schrodingers differential equation using results based on our previous work which concern semigroup operators. Our method does not use eigenvectors or eigenvalues and the solution depends only from the selected base of the Hilbert space.

entry.title: Intuitionistic Fuzzy Continuity and Uniform Convergence
entry.summary: A few of the algebraic and topological properties of int. fuzzy continuity and int. fuzzy uniform continuity are investigated. Also, the concept of int. fuzzy uniform convergence is introduced thereafter a few result on int. fuzzy uniform convergence are studied.

entry.title: Partition of a Set Which Contains an Infinite Arithmetic (Respectively Geometric) Progression
entry.summary: We prove that for any partition of a set which contains an infinite arithmetic (respectively geometric) progression into two disjoint subsets, at least one of these subsets contains an infinite number of triplets such that each triplet is an arithmetic (respectively geometric) progression.

entry.title: Moebius functions Irreducible Polynomials and Dirichlet Series
entry.summary: We are interested in Moebius function and related topics!

entry.title: Linear Equation in Finite Dimensional Algebra
entry.summary: In the paper I considered methods for solving equations of the form axb+cxd=e in the algebra which is finite dimensional over the field.
entry.arxiv:comment: English text - 7 pages; Russian text - 8 pages

entry.title: Some results on Theory of Infinite Series and Divisor Sums
entry.summary: In this work we present and prove formulas having infinite and finite parts. The finite parts are divisor sums. These sums lead us to very interesting formulas when attached to infinite expressions

entry.title: Fuzzy Anti-bounded Linear Operator
entry.summary: Various types of fuzzy anti-continuity and fuzzy anti-boundedness are defined. A few properties of them are established. The intra and inter relation among various types of fuzzy anti-continuity and fuzzy anti-boundedness are studied.

entry.title: Collatz Problem of Positive Integers
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a serious mistake on Lemma 2.4.

entry.title: Compactable semilattices
entry.summary: We characterize those semilattices that give rise to Boolean spaces on their associated spaces of ultrafilters. The class of 0-disjunctive semilattices, important in the theory of congruence-free inverse semigroups, plays a distinguished role in this theory.

entry.title: A proof of Lindelöf's hypothesis
entry.summary: We define an associated Lindel\"of-function for the ratio of the zeta functions and use its representation to get a unique extension of Lindel\"of's function that proves Lindel\"of's hypothesis.

entry.title: Acid zeta function and ajoint acid zeta function
entry.summary: In this paper we set up the theory of acid zeta function and ajoint acid zeta function, based on the theory, we point out a reason to doubt the truth of the Riemann hypothesis and also as a consequence, we give out some new RH equivalences.

entry.title: The order of complex numbers
entry.summary: In this paper, we define an ordering relation for a set of complex numbers, and research the properties and theorems of the ordering, solve some simple complex inequalities with the ordering.

entry.title: Smarandache's Cevian Triangle Theorem in The Einstein Relativistic Velocity Model of Hyperbolic Geometry
entry.summary: In this note, we present a proof of Smarandache's cevian triangle hyperbolic theorem in the Einstein relativistic velocity model of hyperbolic geometry.
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Progress in Physics 2010 vol.3

entry.title: Nested-set inconsistency
entry.summary: This paper examines a denumerable version of the nested-set theorem and derives from it a contradiction involving the formal consistency of the actual infinity assumed by the Axiom of Infinity.

entry.title: Contact geometry and the Poincaré conjecture
entry.summary: We give a simple proof of the Poincar\'e conjecture by using the contact Ricci flow associated with the Reeb vector field.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper has been withdrawn by the author due to a serious gap in defining contact Ricci flow

entry.title: Can We Prove Goldbach's Conjecture?
entry.summary: In this paper we will propose a strategy to prove Goldbach's conjecture: every even integer greater than 2 can be written as the sum of two primes.

entry.title: A Generalization of Certain Remarkable Points of the Triangle Geometry
entry.summary: In this article we prove a theorem that will generalize the concurrence theorems that are leading to the Franke's point, Kariya's point, and to other remarkable points from the triangle geometry.

entry.title: Cone Normed Linear Spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we introduce cone normed linear space, study the cone convergence with respect to cone norm. Finally, we prove the completeness of a finite dimensional cone normed linear space.

entry.title: L-Fuzzy Semi-Preopen Operator in L-Fuzzy Topological Spaces
entry.summary: In this paper, we give the concept of L-fuzzy Semi-Preopen operator in L-fuzzy topological spaces, and use them to score L-fuzzy SP-cmpactnness in L-fuzzy topological spaces. We also study the relationship between L-fuzzy SP-compactness and SP-compactness in L-topological spaces.

entry.title: Elementary Evaluation of the Zeta and Related Functions
entry.summary: A simple and elementary derivation of values at integer points for the Riemann's zeta and related functions is reported.
entry.arxiv:comment: ICNAAM 2010: International Conference of Numerical Analysis and Applied Mathematics, Rhodes, Greece, 19-25 September 2010

entry.title: Numerical Chaos in a Fractional Order Logistic Map
entry.summary: In this paper we investigate a fractional order logistic map and its discrete time dynamics. We show some basic properties of the fractional logistic map and numerically study its period-doubling route to chaos.

entry.title: Solutions to Yang-Mills equations
entry.summary: This article gives explicit solutions to the Yang-Mills equations. The solutions have positive energy that can be made arbitrarily small by selection of a parameter showing that Yang-Mills field theories do not have a mass gap.

entry.title: The attractor structure of logarithmic iterations in the complex plane
entry.summary: We use the methods of empirical mathematics to show that iterative logarithmic operations will result in an attractor point on the complex plane. Moreover, we demonstrate that different bases converge onto different attractors. Finally, we elicit the geometric structure of these attractors.

entry.title: On Q-Fuzzy Ideal Extensions in Semigroups
entry.summary: In this paper the concept of extension of a Q-fuzzy ideal in semigroups has been introduced and some important properties have been studied.
entry.arxiv:comment: This paper is sumitted to SDU journal of science

entry.title: The distribution of the non-prime numbers - A new Sieve
entry.summary: We present a new sieve that allows us to find the prime numbers by using only regular patterns and, more importantly, avoiding any duplication of elements between them.

entry.title: Fuzzy h-ideals of a $Γ-$hemiring and its operator hemirings
entry.summary: Various correspondence between fuzzy h-ideals of a $\Gamma$-hemiring and fuzzy h-ideals of its operator hemirings are established and some of their characterizations are given using lattice structure and cartesian product.

entry.title: On Ergodic Hypothesis
entry.summary: In this paper The Ergodic Hypothesis is proven for one class of functions defined in the infinite dimensional unite cube where is given an action of some semigroup of mappings without the condition on metric transitivity. The result has not a finite analog.

entry.title: The First Derivative of Ramanujans Cubic Continued Fraction
entry.summary: We give the complete evaluation of the first derivative of the Ramanujans cubic continued fraction using Elliptic functions. The Elliptic functions are easy to handle and give the results in terms of Gamma functions and radicals from tables.

entry.title: Triplets of Tri-Homological Triangles
entry.summary: In this article we prove some theorems related to the triplets of triangles, homological two by two. These theorems will be used later to build triplets of triangles two by two tri-homological.

entry.title: Formulas for the approximation of the complete Elliptic Integrals
entry.summary: In this article we give evaluations of the two complete elliptic integrals $K$ and $E$ in the form of Ramanujans type-$\pi$ formulas. The result is a formula for $\Gamma(1/4)^2\pi^{-3/2}$ with accuracy about 120 digits per term.

entry.title: Some new Inequalities of Hardy-Hilbert Type with general kernel
entry.summary: In this paper, by using hardy inequality, we establish some new integral inequalities of Hardy-Hilbert type with general kernel. As applications, equivalent forms and some particular results are built; the corresponding to the double series inequalities are given.reverse forms are considered also.

entry.title: Generalizations of Holder's and some related integral inequalities on fractal space
entry.summary: Based on the local fractional calculus, we establish some new generalizations of H\"{o}lder's inequality. By using it, some results on the generalized integral inequality in fractal space are investigated in detail.

entry.title: Fourier Cosine and Sine Transform on fractal space
